WriteAction.ScriptBody:
#quick and dirty param([string] $source)
New-EventLog LogName 'Operations Manager' Source 'Hyper-V Dynamic Discovery' -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
Write-EventLog -LogName 'Operations Manager' -Source 'Hyper-V Dynamic Discovery' -EntryType Information -EventId 62002 -Message $source

param([string]$VMName=$(throw 'must have a value'))
[Threading.Thread]::CurrentThread.CurrentCulture = "en-US" [Threading.Thread]::CurrentThread.CurrentUICulture = "en-US"
$g_Api = New-Object -comObject 'MOM.ScriptAPI' $HVHost= gwmi -Class win32_computersystem $g_API.LogScriptEvent('Write-Me.ps1',1022,4, "I'm $VMName and I'm being monitored by $($hvhost.name) in domain $($hvhost.domain)")

DisplayString.Name: Hyper-V 2012R2 - Dynamic VM Discovery New Partition Hook
Hyper-V 2012R2 - Dynamic VM Discovery Time hook
Hyper-V 2012 R2 - Total CPU Usage
DisplayString.Description: Totale CPU Usage for both parten and child partitions.

DisplayString.Name: Hyper-V - Dynamic Memory pressure
Hyper-V - Collect VM Measured CPU Usage
Hyper-V - Collect VM Measured Average Memory usage (MB)
Hyper-V - Collect VM Measured Maximum Memory Usage (MB)
Hyper-V - Collect VM Measured Normalized IOPS
Hyper-V - Collect VM Measured Average Disk Latency
Hyper-V - Collect VM Measured Disk Data Read per seconds (MB/sec) Delta mode
Hyper-V - Collect VM Measured Disk Data Written per seconds (MB/sec) Delta mode
Hyper-V - Collect VHD Measured Normalized IOPS
Hyper-V - Collect VHD Measured Average Disk Latency
QND Hyper-V 2012 R2 VM Monitoring
DisplayString.Description: A community MP for adavnced VM monitoring on Hyper-V 2012 R2

DisplayString.Name: Hyper-V - Replica has issues
DisplayString.Description: Replica State is:{0}. Replica Health is:{1}. Last replica age in hours is:{2}

DisplayString.Name: Hyper-V - Old snapshot is present
Hyper-V - Integration Services are out dated
DisplayString.Description: Integration Services Version is: {0}. Integration Services reported status is: {1}.

DisplayString.Name: HyperV - Disables Integration Services version monitoring for *nix VM
Hyper-V 2012 R2 - Discovers VM Primary Replica
Hyper-V - VHD fragmentation level high
DisplayString.Description: VHD Fragmentation is {0}. Higher than the threshold set.

DisplayString.Name: GPUs installed in this server are not RemoteFX capable. Virtual machines that are configured to use the GPU will not start.
DisplayString.Description: GPUs installed in this server are not RemoteFX capable. Virtual machines that are configured to use the GPU will not start.

DisplayString.Name: GPUs installed in the server are not of the same make and model.
DisplayString.Description: The server currently hosts GPUs that are not of the same make and model. This configuration is not valid for RemoteFX. RemoteFX requires that GPUs installed in the server must be of the same make and model.

DisplayString.Name: Hyper-V - VHD Write Bytes per sec
Hyper-V - vNIC Bytes Received Per Second
Hyper-V - vNIC Bytes Sent Per Second
Hyper-V - VHD Read Bytes per sec
Hyper-V - Checkpoint Remove
DisplayString.Description: Remove a checkpoint from a VM

DisplayString.Name: Hyper-V - Live Migrate VM
DisplayString.Description: Live migrates an highly available VM

DisplayString.Name: Hyper-V - Checkpoint Restore
DisplayString.Description: Restore a checkpoint to a VM
